$!You must tell DVLA if you have vertigo.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIZ1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DIZ1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 182KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065610.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIZ1V send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DIZ1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 182KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_4018276.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have vertigo - download the correct form to let them know
title: Vertigo and driving
